title: Drawing, "Five motifs for ornamental arabesques", ca. 1770
medium: Graphite, pen and brown ink with ink wash on three pieces of paper
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Above, arabesque motifs of two arms joined by a half figure in the center, and upon which two nude figures sit.  The figure in the center holds up a line with garlands.  Center left, an arabesque terminating in a nude standing warrior with spear and shield.  Center right, a flying nude figure holding a medallion from which is suspended two garlands and a lamp.  Lower left, a corner motif of a ceiling decoration with arabesques, sphinxes and winged genii.  Lower right, a vertical arabesque panel that includes a siren from which is suspended an oval medallion, and above, a standing putto holding two draperies. Ink framing lines.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Five motifs for ornamental arabesques", ca. 1770.
ca. 1770. Graphite, pen and brown ink with ink wash on three pieces of paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-196.
